description:
Establishments on short-time work

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
13211 Labour market statistics of the Federal Employment
Agency

Definition:
Establishments on short-time work are establishments to
which the Federal Employment Agency will grant short-time
working benefit on application. The precondition is that the
establishment is affected by an unavoidable, temporary
shortage of work due to economic reasons or because of an
inevitable event. The work shortage must lead to a reduction
of more than 10 percent in the gross remuneration of at
least a third of the establishment's employees in the
relevant calendar month. Granting short-time working benefit
to employees as a partial wage replacement serves to retain
experienced staff in the establishment, to stabilise jobs
and to prevent unemployment.
